question: How do you want to see the results of your query?
subtitle: Query Type

answers.label: I want to have a LIST of note links matching my query
I want to have a TABLE of my note links with additional data as columns for each result

extras.message: Please give a comma separated list of meta data that represents each column.

extras.title: Meta data keys with spaces
extras.message: If your meta data key contain spaces, you cannot use it as-is. It won't get recognized. Please replace all spaces with dashes and write it lower case, i.e. if your key is 'Todays Good Deeds', use 'todays-good-deeds' in dataview queries.

answers.label: I want to have a TASK list that summarizes my tasks
I want to see a CALENDAR which shows each note as a dot

extras.message: Each note needs a valid date meta data field to show in CALENDAR view, otherwise the query won't render. Good picks are i.e. file.ctime or file.mtime. The date meta data field determines on which day the note gets displayed.

extras.label: Which date field should be used?

question: Do you want to include all notes in your vault or only those from a particular source?
subtitle: Page sources

answers.label: I want to include all notes
I only want to show notes that have a particular tag
I only want to show notes inside a specific root-level folder (and its subfolders)
I only want to show notes inside a specific subfolder

extras.message: Give the path starting from and exclusive your vault folder, separated by slashes (/)

extras.label: Path to folder from vault root

answers.label: I only want to show notes that link to my current note
I only want to show notes that my current note links to
I only want to show notes that link to a specific note
I only want to show notes that are linked to from a specific note

question: Do you want to filter your results further based on the notes metadata?
subtitle: Filter pages

answers.label: No, I want to see all notes returned by my FROM statement
I only want to see notes where a particular field exists
I only want to see notes where a particular field equals a certain value (number, string, date, etc)
I only want to see notes where a particular field contains certain value (inside an array, or as part of a string)

extras.message: Using the contains function allows you to either search for a substring in texts, i.e. it'll find 'Lorem ipsum' if you search for 'Lor' or to search a multi-value field for one element. Hit the ? on the answer to read more about contains().

I want to compare to a text value
I want to compare to a date

extras.message: Specify the date you want to compare against in ISO format, i.e. 2020-05-30 or 2020-12-24T18:00. Click the ? icon on the answer option to see more input possibilities.

extras.label: Name of file to check against

question: How do you want the results sorted?
subtitle: Sorting

answers.label: Ascending after file path or group key, if I choose to group next (default behaviour)
Based on the note name
Based on the note's creation date
Based on my own metadata field

question: In which direction you want your results sorted?
subtitle: Sort Direction

answers.label: Ascending (A-Z, 0-9, oldest to newest)
Descending (Z-A, 9-0, newest to oldest)

question: Do you want similar results grouped together based on one of their metadata values?
subtitle: Grouping

answers.label: No, I want one result line per note
Group based on the folder they belong to.

extras.message: After grouping, you need to prepend a 'rows.' to all fields you want to have as output and all data commands that come after GROUP BY. The Query Builder does take care of that for you.

answers.label: Group based on the tags they have.
answers.dataview: FLATTEN file.etags AS tags GROUP BY tags

extras.message: After grouping, you need to prepend a 'rows.' to all fields you want to have as output and all data commands that come after GROUP BY. The Query Builder does take care of that for you.
The tags of a file are a multivalue field. When grouping after a multivalue field, you need to FLATTEN it first, so that every single value of the multivalue field becomes its own group.

answers.label: Group based on the month they were created.

extras.message: After grouping, you need to prepend a 'rows.' to all fields you want to have as output and all data commands that come after GROUP BY. The Query Builder does take care of that for you.

answers.label: Group based on my own single value metadata field

extras.message: After grouping, you need to prepend a 'rows.' to all fields you want to have as output and all data commands that come after GROUP BY. The Query Builder does take care of that for you.

answers.label: Group based on my own multi value metadata field
